MICS Data Analyses Ainhoa Ugarteche 2025-04-25 Overall Comments This bookdown was created to structure the workflow of my MICS data analyses. It was also thought to easily share these analytical steps & results. The goal of these analyses is to assess feasibility of MAIHDA models with the children under 5 data. The first focus is interested in data relating to Pakistan. Unlike in other countries, data in Pakistan was delivered by geographical areas. Four geographical areas are distinguished: Balochistan, Sindh, Punjab & Pakshtukistan. My thought is that there were independent statistical teams who deployed the data collections in such regions. Some variables are available in some regions while others are not. For now, this data discrepancy across regions does not concern our analyses.

Chapter 1 ECDI variables 1.1 A) Raw configuration Output Observations 1.2 B) Number of individuals with exploitable information Output Observations 1.3 C) Desciption of ECDI in each region Output Observations

Chapter 1 ECDI variables Context: Creation of Early Childhood Development Index. The ECDI consists of 4 dimensions: (1)Literacy-numeracy, (2)Physical, (3)Social-emotional, (4)Approaches to learning. In total 10 questions are distributed across these dimensions, making up a 10-item ECDI. The ECDI is a binary variable: (a)Being developmentally on track VS (b)Not being on track ECDI items are coded such that answers to questions are 1: YES & 2: NO. Extra codes are for Dont Know (8) & No response(9). Below I describe the variables associated to each ECDI dimension and the scores (answers) contributing to being developmentally on-track: (1)Literacy-numeracy: Vars: EC6, EC7, EC8 Developmentally on track: Having a score of 1 in at least 2 out of the 3 items. (2)Physical EC9=1 OR EC10=2 (3)Approaches to learning: EC9=1 OR EC10=1 (4)Social-emotional: At least 2 out of the 3 items received these scores: EC13=1 , EC14=2 , EC15=2 In this table we describe, in text format, the answers contributing to being developmentally on track. Figure: ECDI: Answers Contributing to Being Developmentally On Track My data consists of datasets of the 4 regions in Pakistan: Balochistan, Pahktukistan, Punjab, Sindh. All household member data was merged in these datasets. I use UF17 var(completion of children under 5 questionnaire) to select only data relating to children under 5 y.o. Those who are developmentally on track as per the ECDI are those who are developmentally on track in at least 3 out of the 4 dimensions Code #CREATING VARIABLES DEVELOPMENTALLY ON TRACK VS NOT #Filter by individuals who have information across all variables filtercreateECDI<-function(data){ data <- data %>% filter(if_all(all_of(ECDIvars), ~ !is.na(.))) #if_all in filter. across in mutate() data <- data %>% mutate( # Domain 1: Literacy-numeracy  at least 2 out of 3 are 1 (YES) literacy_track = rowSums(across(c(EC6, EC7, EC8), ~ . == 1), na.rm = TRUE) >= 2, # Domain 2: Physical  EC9 == 1 OR EC10 == 2 physical_track = case_when(EC9 == 1 | EC10 == 2 ~"TRUE", TRUE~"FALSE"), # Domain 3: Approaches to learning  EC11 == 1 OR EC12 == 1 learning_track = case_when(EC11 == 1 | EC12 == 1 |EC11 == 1 & EC12 == 1 ~ "TRUE", TRUE~"FALSE"), # Domain 4: Social-emotional  at least 2 out of 3 specific conditions socioemotional_track = rowSums(cbind(EC13 == 1, EC14 == 2, EC15 == 2), na.rm = TRUE) >= 2, # Final ECDI: Developmentally on track if ALL 4 domains are TRUE ECDI = rowSums(cbind(socioemotional_track == TRUE, learning_track == "TRUE", physical_track == "TRUE", literacy_track == TRUE), , na.rm = TRUE) >= 3 ) return(data) } Balo_f2<-filtercreateECDI(Balo_f) Pahktu_f2<-filtercreateECDI(Pahktu_f) Punjab_f2<-filtercreateECDI(Punjab_f) Sindh_f2<-filtercreateECDI(Sindh_f) Output #gwpvdqijyl table { font-family: system-ui, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif, 'Apple Color Emoji', 'Segoe UI Emoji', 'Segoe UI Symbol', 'Noto Color Emoji';
